meanings.definition: large flies that lay their eggs on dead or decaying matter
meanings.sent1: The blowflies buzzed around the rotting fruit.
meanings.sent2: The farmer noticed blowflies hovering over the animal carcass.
meanings.sent3: The blowflies seemed to have a party on the spoiled meat.
meanings.sent4: The field was a playground for blowflies, attracted to the decaying plants.
meanings.sent5: The sight of blowflies swarming the garbage bin was unsettling.
meanings.sent6: After the rain, blowflies gathered around the soggy compost pile.
meanings.sent7: Blowflies are often found near waste bins behind restaurants.
meanings.sent8: The blowflies were drawn to the stench of the old fish.

meanings.definition: to be infested or bothered by blowflies
meanings.sent1: The hiker was blowflies by the pesky insects during the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The campers tried to enjoy their meal but were constantly blowflies.
meanings.sent3: As soon as the food was out, they were blowflies by the persistent pests.
meanings.sent4: The outdoor barbecue was blowflies by unwanted guests.
meanings.sent5: The family had to eat quickly before being blowflies by the annoying flies.
meanings.sent6: The outdoor market was blowflies by the buzzing insects.
meanings.sent7: The picnic area was blowflies by the unwelcome visitors.
meanings.sent8: The children were blowflies by the insects while playing in the park.
